message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DS

This paper deals with the problem of semantic composition in vector space models of semantics, which is a core topic in computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also discusses the use of probabilistic graphical models, which is a common technique in machine learning (cs.LG). The paper's focus on modelling context-dependent meanings and composing distributed representations suggests that it could also be relevant to the sub-categories of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and information retrieval (cs.IR). Finally, the paper's use of conditional probabilities and probabilistic modelling could also make it relevant to the sub-category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
